message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses a recent classifier idea called Multithreshold Entropy Linear Classifier (MELC) which employs information theoretic concepts to create a multithreshold maximum margin model. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) as it deals with a classifier idea. Additionally, the paper analyzes the consistency of MELC over multithreshold linear models, which could fall under the sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The paper also conducts numerical experiments on datasets, indicating that it could belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) or Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the use of entropy in the classifier suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
